direction.raw_text: (sighs) Ah, my young friend... I neglected to tell you that Jake attacks his job with a certain... exuberance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ... I'm being beat up by the inventor of Scrabble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's still in a good mood, Jake. Kick him again. Jake steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Hallenbeck speaks through cracked, bloody lips:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want the fucking evidence that the stripper had. I've got it. So we can play games, or I can hand it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then you'll let us go, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure.  We'll let you go. (to Hallenbeck) Where is it? Hallenbeck meets the Tall Man's gaze.    Speaks softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hand me the car keys, Jimmy. Jimmy stumbles to his feet.    Looks at the Tall Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walk over and hand him the keys. Slow and easy. Jimmy takes out the car keys.    Crosses to Hallenbeck. Gives him the keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The evidence is in the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open it.     Slow. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Hallenbeck smiles.    Shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. He turns and throws the keys as far as he can. They fall out of sight behind a cottage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oops.    I guess nobody gets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You dumb bastard, you're going to pay for that. Jake, open the trunk. Jake steps forward, drawing a .38 silenced pistol. He is going to shoot open the lock. ANGLE ON HALLENBECK This is what he's been waiting for. He tenses, looking to one side: next to him is a sloping hillside, angling down and away. He grips Jimmy's wrist, signalling to get ready. Jake raises the PISTOL.    Take aim at the lock and FIRES. The SHOT is SILENCED.    What follows is not. Because the bullet blows through the trunk -- And hits three sticks of live dynamite. SERIES OF SHOTS Hallenbeck is already moving, pitching to one side, throwing himself and Jimmy down the hillside. The night lights up like a SUNBURST. A tower of fire... Climbs up and outward from the car. The TRUNK LID is BLOWN fifty feet in the air. The tires are pulped. GLASS SPRAYS for fifty yards in every direction. And, most importantly:    both hitmen are engulfed in flame. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: SOUND. Fury. Flames, rolling skyward. TINKLE of raining GLASS. Bits of falling metal. All in all, a helluva blast, and meanwhile: JIMMY AND JOE continue to careen down the hillside. Bouncing like rag puppets. Out of control. Lurch to stop at the bottom. Covered head to toe with dirt.      Bruised.   Bloody. Alive. They lie side by side, sucking air -- Until they both hear an odd noise: The sound of CRUMPLING METAL. The sound is GETTING LOUDER. They both crane their necks in time to see -- The flaming car, tumbling end over end Coming down the hill. Heading straight for them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus fucking Christ! They both dive for cover, out of the way. Barely make it. The CAR plows past them in a shower of dirt. CRUMPLING. Heaving. Spitting fire. Finally SLAMS to a halt against a palm tree. Burns. The night is filled with SHOUTS and CURSES. The sound of DOORS OPENING. The crackle of flames. ON GROUND Joe rolls over.    Looks at Jimmy.    Jimmy looks at Joe. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know yet. They crawl to their feet, inspecting for broken bones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dynamite?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Either that, or we're looking at a major factory recall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead guys... don't make bad jokes, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we're alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.    Hooray. He spits blood as SIRENS once more fill the night air, APPROACHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go.   Get out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get the fuck out of here, I'll take the heat on this one. Rent a car. Then go home and wait for my call. Do it. Jimmy meets Joe's eyes.    Nods.   Dashes off into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, this is a police matter, you son of a bitch! I'm sick and fucking tired of sweeping up your dead bodies, Joe, and the next time I see your ugly mug I'm puttin' a bullet in it. You got that? You are off the case, buddy. Is that clear? Hallenbeck stares at him.   Blows smoke.    Says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you thought there was dynamite in the trunk, wait'll you see this. Hallenbeck reaches into the envelope and extracts a photograph: Two men having lunch together on a secluded patio. Both are older, distinguished-looking. Joe suddenly looks very pale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guy on the left is Connie Marcon, the owner of the L.A. Stallions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about him. Look at the guy on the right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sort of familiar. Who is he?

direction.raw_text: Senator Calvin Baynard. Jimmy draws a sharp breath.   Pause, then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go back to the cops.   I'm scared.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take it easy, kid. It's not so bad. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so bad. Excuse me, did you just say the words not so bad? You don't understand, Joe, see, if a guy vomits on the sidewalk, you don't say, 'Oh, hey, it's not so bad, there's some ham in there.' It's fucking vomit, okay? This is bad. Hallenbeck nervously lights a cigarette. Stares straight ahead through the windshield.   Begins to talk:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I was thirty, I was on the President's personal security force. Once night I was on the way home from a late session. I'm on the highway just outside of Georgetown when I see something up ahead. MEMORY FLASH Another time. Another night. A younger-looking Hallenbeck. Rugged features. Clipped military haircut. He is driving. Down a turnpike, squinting through dense evening mist. Up ahead, a shape materializes out of the fog: WRECKED CAR is lying upside down in a pool of shattered glass. He SCREECHES to a stop. ANOTHER ANGLE In a dream-like SLOW MOTION, he approaches the overturned car. There are two dead bodies inside. A woman. A little boy. In the window, a stuffed Garfield doll clings with suction cups to the remaining glass. The furry cat is splattered with blood. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a high-speed collision. Both cars were totaled. The woman and the boy were dead. The driver of the other car wasn't. STAGGERING DRUNK is weaving toward Hallenbeck. Leaving behind his crumpled Mercedes. He wears an $800 suit. Tan Cordovan loafers.   Silk tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuckin' bitch... She got in front of me, man. Shit. My fuckin' car. Stupid bitch wrecked my car... He stumbles toward Hallenbeck, eyes attempting to focus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know who I am...? I'm Louis Baynard, my father is Calvin D. Baynard, man. Call my father, he'll take care of it. The man lurches to a stop in front of Hallenbeck. Clutching at Joe's lapels. Wheezing liquor fumes. He presses a hundred dollar bill into Joe's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll tell 'em what happened, right...? Bitch swerved in front of me, man. Wrecked my fuckin' Mercedes. Right...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could smell bourbon on him, big time. He was  standing there, not a scratch on him. I went a little nuts. I hit  him. In SLOW MOTION, Hallenbeck backhands the rich drunk, with a head-snapping impact that bursts lips. Breaks teeth. We see the Drunk's head slowly strike the asphalt. A sickening concussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blow was non-lethal. But when he fell, his head hit the pavement funny. Put him in a coma. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: The younger Hallenbeck stands on the highway of eight years past, staring at the Drunk with fierce, blazing eyes as we -- SNAP BACK TO: JIMMY AND JOE - BACK TO PRESENT Driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even when he came out of it, he was never right in the head. His dad fixed everything with the cops. The accident report disappeared. A week later the police found half a kilo of crack cocaine planted in my house. Acting on an anonymous tip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The senator fucked your job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And my pension. And my marriage. Only reason I'm still licensed to carry a gun, the man himself made a few calls. Since then I'm just playing it out. Day by day. Jimmy is silent for a moment.   Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cory tumbled to some sort of deal between Marcon and the senator, and they had her killed. (beat) We gotta show this photo to the cops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet. I need more evidence. (beat) I want Baynard, Jimmy. I want to bring him down. I could use your help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because if Baynard takes a fall, so does Marcon. The man who kicked you out of professional football.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. PLUSH BEDROOM - NIGHT A tall, thin, almost effeminate MAN is seated on a couch. High cheekbones. A shock of blond hair. Glittering, malignant eyes. He is directing a pornographic film. PRETTY GIRL is bound hand and foot to the posts of a lavishly appointed bed. Around her, the room is filled with Kleig lights. Reflectors. Camera equipment. The girl is scowling furiously.    She speaks to the director:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want the sheets changed, Milo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you do, but we're running behind, dearest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't give a shit. I'm an actress, not a piece of meat, and I want clean sheets!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. It's done. Right after this next shot. A strident BEEPER GOES OFF on Milo's belt. He turns to the two-man crew and claps his hands for attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, let's do it. (beat) Roll camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rolling.

direction.raw_text: And... action! The closet door opens. A hulking man emerges. He is carrying a chainsaw. The Girl on the bed stares, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo... What the fuck is this, some kind of joke? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not at all, dearest. It's what's known as a snuff film. The hulking man pulls the starter cord.        The SAW ROARS to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God Milo please oh God oh no please Miloooo!! A smile twitches Milo's upper lip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, Pablo.   She's not a piece of meat. He exits.    Closes a sound-proofed door behind him. INT. WOOD-PANELED STUDY - CONTINUOUS ACTION Milo enters, all business. Crosses to a telephone with a blinking light. Stabs a button. Scoops up the receiver.

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mr. Marcon? How can I help you?

direction.raw_text: Is this line secure?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One hundred percent, sir. I wouldn't have used your name otherwise.

direction.raw_text: Who is he working for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From available information, he appears to be a free agent. Guy by the name of Joe Hallenbeck. Milo sits and begins punching keys on a computer. (CONTINUED)

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me everything you can on this fucker, Milo. I want it on my computer screen in fifteen minutes.

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.   And then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then you'll be handling it personally. EXT. HALLENBECK HOME - LATE NIGHT Dawn is a ghost on the horizon as Jimmy parks the rental Subaru outside. The two men emerge. Head for the front door.

direction.raw_text: So I get to meet your family, huh? What's your daughter like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's like thirteen. And if you even look at her funny, I'll shove an umbrella up your ass and open it. INT. HALLENBECK HOUSE - CONTINUOUS ACTION As they come through the front door, Joe's daughter, DARIAN, is slumped in a big Lazy-Boy, staring sullenly at a movie on TV. Cute kid, cursed to wear ridiculous- looking dental headgear. She doesn't bother to look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First things first. I'm starving. (notices Darian) Hey, kiddo. Why aren't you in bed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm watching television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can see that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate you.   Leave me alone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: She still won't look at him. The two men cross to the kitchen. Hallenbeck opens the refrigerator, takes out some lunchmeat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's pissed off because I wouldn't let her go out on a date with her friend Billy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I missed the biggest party of the year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why couldn't she go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (incredulous) Because she's thirteen, that's why. (to Darian) I bought you some ice cream.

direction.raw_text: I'm not talking to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, that's a shame. You always have such pleasant things to say.

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. L.A.P.D. ROBBERY/HOMICIDE DIVISION - NIGHT Sergeant Benjamin Bessalo is in the mood to kick things. A metal trashcan is booted across the room with a clang as he whirls, glaring at Joe Hallenbeck, who is seated before him. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: hate you, Dad.' I'm gonna miss that, darn it... (beat) It's chocolate chip, your favorite.

direction.raw_text: That's for saying asshole. God, I hate wasting food. Wanna abuse me some more? Go ahead, shock me. You know, I hardly ever hear the word asshole.

direction.raw_text: All right, that's it. You wanna be a gutter mouth? You wanna sound like your mother, well that's terrific. Christ, all day long I don't take enough abuse, I gotta listen to shit from you!

direction.raw_text: Hey, Joe, take it easy...

direction.raw_text: Don't you tell me how to talk to my kid.

direction.raw_text: All I wanted was to go to a party, but Pop here thinks I'm out to get laid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go for it, kiddo. All the dirty words. Come on, shock me. Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure thing, you dumb fuck-up. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I've had it. Go to your room. Or I will whip your behind.

direction.raw_text: You'd probably like it. Hallenbeck takes her by the arm and drags her out of the chair. Toward her room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, you are my daughter and you will respect me, got that? You got it? You don't ever call me a fuck-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why shouldn't I, Mom calls you that all the time. That stops him.   He looks at her, stricken.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the phone to Uncle Jay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uncle Jay? Ohh, Christ, I'm a fuck-up, but Uncle Jay, now there's a real stand-up guy. Shit, the bastard cheats on his tax form, I'm surprised he hasn't done time! Why don't you ask your mother why Mister Wonderful isn't in jail for tax evasion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) Because he doesn't fuck up. She goes into her room and shuts the door. Hallenbeck rubs his eyes. Leans against the wall, exhausted.

direction.raw_text: You know, for fifty bucks you could get a guy to pull out her fingernails with a pair of pliers. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Anything that much fun, I'd want to do myself.

direction.raw_text: I think we could both use a drink. Hallenbeck   crosses to a cabinet, breaks out a bottle of Seagrams.    Swigs.  Hands it to Jimmy. As Jimmy drinks, he notices   a photo on the wall: Hallenbeck shaking hands with   George Bush.

direction.raw_text: That's you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.    That's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like the dad on 'The Brady Bunch.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I was a regular Boy Scout. Joe starts to fix a sandwich.      Jimmy takes nips from the bottle.

direction.raw_text: So.    You gonna get a divorce?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't know. He bites into the sandwich.      Not really tasting it.

direction.raw_text: You don't like women much, do you, Joe?

direction.raw_text: (mouth full) Mike Miller wasn't the first time. Sarah has cheated on me before. Twice. I never told her I knew. At first, my opinion of women took a real dip, yeah.

direction.raw_text: And now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I'm content if I like the guy she's fucking. This last one was my best friend. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Horseshit, he was a scumbag private eye.

direction.raw_text: What am I, Jimmy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tried to get you killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friends can't be perfect. (sighs) I wish the sky wasn't blue. I wish water wasn't wet. I wish I didn't still love my wife. He eats in silence.   Jimmy says:

direction.raw_text: You know what I did last night?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I went to a party and shit on a car.

direction.raw_text: Damn.   You, too?

direction.raw_text: I'm a complete loser. Capital 'L.' All I ever wanted... was to be somebody's hero, you know it...? Now I mostly sit around. Watch T.V. Get laid. I'm a fucking slug, throw salt on me I'd curl up. Life sucks.

direction.raw_text: You're wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life doesn't suck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, life sucks. But you're not a loser. Cory loved you.

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and the last thing I did was cheat on her. (beat) Why do people cheat, Joe? (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's easier than paying the tax, Junior.

direction.raw_text: Ooooooh.     Very deep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So deep I don't know what the fuck it means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means another drink is required. He raises the bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alex the accountant. He drinks.   Hallenbeck frowns, watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is Alex your accountant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  But he could have been. (beat) Alex was my son. Hallenbeck stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was married at 19. Sweet young thing, looking to get out from under daddy's thumb. I didn't know she was a junkie. All during her pregnancy. Shooting up. There were complications. She died. Alex lived for seventeen minutes in the incubator. Fell asleep. Died before he woke up. (takes a drink) He was born... He had time for one dream... and then he died. I wonder what his dream was about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think about him a lot.     I mean, who was this... guy? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This little guy who only got seventeen minutes, who was he, Joe...? What was he like? (beat) What would he have been?

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) No. He had to die, Joe.     Don't you see?

direction.raw_text: Why did he have to die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly) Because he came out of me. He puts aside the bottle.    Scowls.

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna borrow your shower. He exits.    Hallenbeck watches him go.     Says nothing. INT. BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS ACTION Jimmy enters and shuts the door. Turns on the shower. Makes no move to undress. Instead, he reaches inside the waistband on his pants. Removes a vial of coke. Dips a spoon. The door opens. Hallenbeck is standing there with a handful of fresh towels. He stops. Staring at Jimmy. They freeze in tableau. Then Hallenbeck crosses the floor with two quick strides and slugs Jimmy with all his might. Decks him. The kid goes over backward into the shower, head striking the porcelain. He swerves. Claws his way out, drenched.

direction.raw_text: Not in my house, you dumb motherfucker. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Oh, sure, Dudley fucking Do-Right, you stand there and judge me, and, meanwhile, you never had your old lady die on you, did you, pal?? And your fucking kid?? And I said to God, 'Hey, buddy, what gives? I go to church, I give to the United Way, what is this dead wife and kid shit...?' And he didn't say nothin', Joe. He grabs a towel.   Scrubs savagely at his wet torso.

direction.raw_text: And then I lose my job, my fucking life, okay, and why...? You know why? Because I gambled. Whoa, hold on, stop the presses, Jimmy gambled, well shit, of course I gambled, everybody does, and the fucking league knows it! He advances on Joe, trembling with anger.

direction.raw_text: Why, Joe? Why is there an injury report in pro football, huh...? Nobody else has a fucking injury report, but the N.F.L. does, so the fucking gamblers will know the spread! Marcon... the commissioner ... those fucking hypocrites... killed the last thing I could do, Joe...! I can't do anything... anymore. And suddenly he is crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't save my wife... She died screaming and I couldn't do a Goddamn thing... And my baby came out... and he was so fuckin' small, Joe... He was too fuckin' small... He collapses against the wall. Slides down to a sitting position.   Huddled on the floor. Hallenbeck watches him. Says nothing. For a moment, he seems moved to compassion... Then his gaze hardens. He kneels next to Jimmy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you're through feeling sorry for yourself, the front door's that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wipes his eyes) You're a total bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You brought cocaine in my house. End of story. Jimmy is silent.   He stands.     Exits into the hall. Joe's daughter, Darian, is standing there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Jimmy Dix, aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? There is an awkward pause. Darian holds out a football card. Young, smiling Jimmy. The card is old. Tattered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I acted like a bitch. Would you sign my card? Hallenbeck steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you to go to your room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, Dad -- !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to bed.   This guy's not signing anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, come off it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it, Darian. (beat) The guy's a loser. Big time. Darian's face is a mask of confusion. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Jimmy walks past her to the front door. Stops with his hand on the knob. Turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never shaved points, Joe.     I never did. Joe is silent.   Stone-faced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you want my help, I'm at the Casa Loma Apartments on Ventura. He exits. Shuts the door behind him. Darian goes into her room, fuming. Shuts the door. Joe is alone.    He turns.   Sees his reflection in the hall mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smile, you fuck. INT. MASTER BEDROOM - DAWN The first light of day streams through the window. Hallenbeck pushes Furry Tom to one side. Sits on the bed. Regards his sleeping wife with hooded, lifeless eyes. She is peaceful. Serene. He reaches out to touch her. Stops. Withdraws his hand. Crushes out the cigarette. Stands. Leaves. INT. DARIAN'S ROOM - SAME TIME Hallenbeck enters. Crosses to Darian's bed. She is asleep. She looks vulnerable. Helpless. He leans over and kisses her. She stirs in her sleep. Murmurs:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy... Hallenbeck recoils. Stares at her. The DOORBELL RINGS. Startling him. He mutters under his breath. Stalks out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER ANGLE - FRONT DOOR Down the hall to the front door.   Flings it open, pissed off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, Jimmy, I told you -- ! It isn't Jimmy. Standing on the porch is a tall, thin man with blond hair. The man removes a TASER GUN from his overcoat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Joseph. He FIRES point-blank. The electrode hits Hallenbeck in the chest. A CRACKLE of electric current. Hallenbeck jerks spastically. The world spirals away. He plunges down into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AT CORNER NEWSSTAND Jimmy buys a paper. Trudges along Ventura Boulevard. Huddled against the chill. SLEEK, BLACK SEDAN slides to the curb in front of him. Two men get out: One is Pablo, who last we saw wielding a chainsaw in Milo's snuff film; the other is an ugly piece of hired muscle who we'll call CHET. The two men flank Jimmy and walk alongside him. He looks up, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, Jimmy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you, and how the fuck do you know my name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (frowns) This is the guy? You sure it's the guy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid with the million-dollar arm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. He don't look like much.     I wouldn't pay no million dollars for this bozo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neither will anyone else, anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm growing whiskers here, guys. You got something to say, fucking say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Tough guy stuff. Must have caught it from his buddy Hallenbeck. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't play dumb, shithead. You were with him last night at the club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Marcon sent us to teach you a lesson, Jimmy. Something about keeping your big coked-up nose out of his fucking business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get ready, kid. This one's an E ticket. And, with that, they grab Jimmy under the arms. Carry him across the sidewalk to a plywood fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, guys, don't do this... Jesus Christ, I was just her boyfriend, I swear to God, please! They toss Jimmy over the fence. ANOTHER ANGLE Not a terrible fate, under normal circumstances. In this case, however -- A fifty-foot drop... Awaits him beyond the fence. A huge, looming pit dug into the earth. Foundation for a new parking garage. Jimmy plummets like a stone. Under normal circumstances, he'd be dead. But since it rained last night, he's got three feet of water to land in. He hits with a splash.   Disappears beneath the water. Surfaces, screaming in pain. Thrashes in the muddy water, and only when he looks down does he notice the splintered bone jutting out of his skin at a crazy angle. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: His million-dollar arm.    His throwing arm. He clutches at cracked ribs, screaming:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God, my arm, my fucking arm, oh Jesus Christ!!! He kneels in the muddy water, rocking back and forth. LONG SHOT - JIMMY Alone in the pit. Huddled in a pool of muddy water. His screams of pain ECHO in the chill, morning air. INT. LAPD ROBBERY/HOMICIDE DIVISION - DAY Ben Bessalo's office, to be precise. Bessalo reclines grumpily at his desk. Scanning reports. McCaskey hangs up the phone and calls across the room: McCASKEY I got bad news and bad news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimmee the bad news first. McCASKEY Bad news is, they just pulled Jimmy Dix out of a construction site on Ventura. He's busted up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, now gimme the bad news. McCASKEY I just got a call from Hallenbeck's neighbor. Bessalo looks up, intrigued.    McCaskey continues: McCASKEY Now, according to Hallenbeck, Mike Miller came to the house early that morning to talk about a case, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: McCASKEY Okay. So how come Hallenbeck's neighbor claims that Miller's car was parked there all night, in the same spot? Bessalo sits bolt upright.   Eyes glazed.   Wheels turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lied.   Why did he lie...? Realization hits him like a thunderbolt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.   Miller was fucking his wife. McCASKEY What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why the car was there, Miller was fucking Hallenbeck's wife, Hallenbeck just got back from out of town, remember? (beat) Christ, Joe wasted the bastard himself! He stabs a button on the phone.   Barks into the receiver:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want an A.P.B. out on Joe Hallenbeck. Now. Find him and if he resists arrest, shoot the bastard. He slams down the phone.   Stares, stricken, at McCaskey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I let him go, Mick. He wasted Mike Miller and waltzed right out of my office, I let him go, Goddammit! McCASKEY Relax, Ben. We'll bring him in. He's not that good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna bet? And, with that, we promptly -- CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOE HALLENBECK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE Weathered.   Sallow.   Dark circles under the eyes. HAND comes INTO FRAME and slaps him.    Hard. Rocks his head to one side. INT. ELEGANT BEACH HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - ANOTHER ANGLE Thick carpet. Polished, wood furniture.     Window walls. Outside, the sea is angry and grey. PABLO AND CHET are standing over Hallenbeck, who is slumped in a chair. Both hitmen wear holstered sidearms. Chet leans over and slaps Hallenbeck again. The big detective begins to stir. His eyelids flutter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think he's awake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make sure. Chet's hand flashes out for a third slap -- And from nowhere, Joe Hallenbeck's hand magically appears. Intercepts the blow. Clamps onto Chet's hand and wrenches it. A cry of pain. Chet stumbles backward, cradling the wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm awake. His eyelids creak open. He squints, adjusting to the light. Studies his captors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You nearly broke my wrist, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life's a bitch. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He starts pawing his coat pockets, looking for a cigarette. In the corner, Pablo chuckles:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo warned us to watch out for this guy. Chet is seething.     He glares at Hallenbeck. Hallenbeck yawns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck that. Look at him. He's nothin'. Guy's a piece of shit. Hallenbeck ignores him.     Sits up.   Rubs tired eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody got a cigarette...? Chet steps forward.     Grins wickedly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure, buddy.     I got a cigarette. He reaches into his shirt pocket. Extracts a Marlboro. Hands it to Hallenbeck. Takes out a lighter. Hallenbeck places the cigarette between his lips. Leans forward for a light -- And Chet slugs him in the face. The cigarette goes flying. Hallenbeck's head snaps back. Blood creeps from his lower lip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (guffaws) Hey, baby, I thought you were tough. See, Pablo, he ain't so bad. Hallenbeck's eyes glint fiercely.      He takes a breath. Leans forward and says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seem to have dropped my cigarette. May I have another? Chet turns, meets his gaze.     The grin falters a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unnerved) Sure.   Sure thing, buddy. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He hands Hallenbeck another smoke. Hallenbeck puts it between his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need a light. (beat) And if you touch me again... I'll kill you. A pregnant pause. The challenge hangs in the air. Slowly, Chet takes the lighter from his pocket. Pablo looks on, a smile twisting his features. Hallenbeck leans forward for a light. Chet extends his arm -- And slugs Hallenbeck in the face again. Rocks him. Chet howls with laughter. Pablo grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baby!   Two for two! The laughter continues. Hallenbeck takes a deep breath. Stands up. Strikes with a flattened palm. Breaks Chet's nose. Drives it up into the brain. Chet stands, pole-axed. Blinks once. Pitches over dead. And suddenly Pablo isn't laughing. He stares at Hallenbeck, incredulous. Stares at Chet, lying on the carpet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ. (draws his gun) You son-of-a-bitch. Jesus Christ!! He rushes to Chet. Kneels beside him. Hallenbeck calmly returns to his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed him! 'Fuckin' A, you killed him, he's fuckin' dead!!! Hallenbeck says nothing. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: At that moment, a door opens, and Milo enters. Slick. Well-dressed. Utterly composed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there a problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still dazed) He killed Chet, Milo. The mother- fucker just killed him! Milo looks toward Hallenbeck. Hallenbeck says nothing. Instead, he calmly leans forward and picks up Chet's lighter from the carpet. Lights his cigarette. Blows smoke. A tense moment... and then Milo does something un- expected: He starts to laugh. Advances into the room, chuckling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my. Oh, Goddamn. Joseph, Joseph, you don't disappoint me. He draws a Walther PPK and approaches Hallenbeck. Smiling and cheerful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seem to have killed one of my men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) I needed a light. Milo nods as if this makes perfect sense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You took an awful risk. Pablo here could have shot you dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you wanted me dead, you'd have already killed me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's true. (sits down) I suppose introductions are in order.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (waves his hand) Fuck it. You're the bad guy, right? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.   I'm the bad guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you've got the gun, and I'm supposed to tremble in fear, something like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. I'll start trembling in a minute. Mind if I have a drink first?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) I don't see why not. Pablo, please take Chet's corpse into the other room, and then fix Mr. Hallenbeck a drink. Suddenly a voice rings out from the doorway:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make that two. Hallenbeck turns toward the new arrival.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, look who's here. Connie Marcon himself. Sure enough, CONRAD MARCON saunters in, just like he owns the place. Which, by the way, he does. Tall, strong, Texas-tough. Dressed in a Saville Row suit. He frowns at Hallenbeck:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, son. Only my friends call me Connie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got friends? When did this happen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (chuckles) I'll give you one thing. You're pretty calm for a man in your position. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're pretty calm for a man whose team is three and six on the year.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're having some problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stink. Marcon's composure falters, but only for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad you're here, Joe. We got a few things to discuss. He takes a moment to gather his thoughts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For starters, I'm sure you're aware that professional football is changing, and not for better. (lights a cigar) Used to be, you went to the local stadium come Sunday, you saw heroes. Guys who fought for their hometown. Anymore, no one gives a shit. Ever since Sonny Werblin paid $400,000 to Joe Namath back in '66, the sons of bitches just got greedier. Playing only for themselves. Giving nothing back to the game. Pablo hands him a double bourbon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This year, the final blow: the N.F.L. votes to decertify the Players Organization. Eliminates the draft, reduces all athletes to free agents. Reduces football, once and for all, to commerce. To greed, you follow?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When do I say the Pledge of Allegiance? Marcon looks directly at Hallenbeck. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know how many ratings points Monday Night Football lost this year? Per week? An average of two point eight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, for Chrissake. You're telling me this whole thing is about TV ratings?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People have stopped watching, Joe! Everybody's turning the channel, they're still looking for heroes, you follow? Guys like you. Milo here tells me you took a bullet for the President, jumped in front of a sniper rifle. Hallenbeck reacts, startled.   Looks at Milo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We took the liberty of researching your background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about it, Joe? Is it truth or hype?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) I got the rifle in my closet as a souvenir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you go, that's what I'm saying. The public wants real heroes. Not a bunch of football prima donnas, jumping from team to team with their fancy lawyers. (beat) In fact, Joe, and this is my point, there's only one reason left nowadays to watch pro- football. Can you guess? It begins to dawn on Hallenbeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gambling. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Gambling. (puffs his cigar) Just one problem: football gambling is illegal in all but two of the fifty states. And that, Joe boy, is where I come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sudden realization) Shit, that's what this is about! You're bribing United States senators. Paying them to pass legislation -- MARCON -- Legalizing football gambling in all fifty states. Exactly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attendance goes up again.   TV ratings go up again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got it, son. The networks are happy. I'm happy. Everybody's happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before we get too fucking happy, let's get a couple things straight: first, I'm not your fucking son, and second... why am I still alive? Marcon stops pacing.   Sighs and sits down facing Hallenbeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like this, Joe: everything was going great until a couple weeks ago, and then I hit a snag: Senator Calvin Baynard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (takes a sip of bourbon) I don't get it. What's the snag?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I offered him the bribe and he wouldn't take it. Hallenbeck actually does a spit-take.     Sprays bourbon. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Baynard? Are you nuts? The guy's so crooked he shits slinkies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allow me to clarify: I offered him the bribe, and he turned it down because he wanted more money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sighs with relief) Thank God. For a minute there I felt hell freezing over. Did he ask for more than a million?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does the Pope shit in the woods? He wants two million or he'll blow the lid off my whole plan. I don't feel like paying no two mil, so basically that good ole' boy's gotta die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taking off a U.S. senator, that's pretty ballsy. Even for an asshole like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm not going to kill Baynard, Joe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is? Marcon says nothing.   Just looks at Hallenbeck and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit. He rubs tired eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm the perfect fall guy. Everyone and his uncle Max knows I hate Baynard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) Anything goes wrong, all the heat lands on you, Joe boy. My hands are clean. Hallenbeck scowls. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any particular reason I should go along with this prize-winning scheme?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles) Just one. He motions to Milo, who disappears through a doorway. Reappears a moment later. He's got Joe's wife. ANGLE ON HALLENBECK He stands. Face contorting. Fists clenched. Rage courses through him like an electric current. Marcon cocks his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down, Joe. A moment.    Joe stands, smouldering.   On fire.   Sarah speaks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what he says, Joe. Joe sits. Breathing shallowly. Eyes locked on Milo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you alright, Sarah?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a temporary condition, Joseph. As you may be aware, there are distributors in Mexico who positively crave snuff films. And unless you do every fucking thing Mr. Marcon tells you... your wife will make her motion picture debut. He meets Joe's murderous gaze... and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. HOSPITAL EMERGENCY ROOM - DAY Meanwhile, back at the ranch, Jimmy is seated, shirtless, on a metal examining table. His ribs are taped. His arm in a cast. Two men loom over him, sour expressions on their faces: Sergeants McCaskey and Bessalo. Jimmy shakes his head, exasperated:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I'll say it again for the cheap seats: I don't know anything and I can't help you. Okay? Can I go now? Bessalo grimaces in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me get this straight: you're walking along, minding your own business, when two guys you never met jump you and throw you in a ditch for no particular reason. Is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're full of shit, kid. (beat) Tell me where Hallenbeck is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the fuck should I know?    Try his house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We did.   Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For Chrissake, I just met the guy. (beat) Look, Sergeant. I don't give a shit about Joe Hallenbeck. I just busted my throwing arm and I'm in a real pissy mood, so you got two choices: either charge me with something or let me the fuck outta here. He glares defiantly at Bessalo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. CASA LOMA APARTMENTS - DAY The grey day wears on. Jimmy trudges stiffly down the walk toward his apartment unit. Pulls up short, staring ahead -- DARIAN HALLENBECK Slumped outside the door to his apartment. Asleep.      A crumpled piece of paper clutched in her hand. He kneels beside her.    Touches her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.    Wake up. She stirs. Awakens, looking at him. Her eyes are puffy and red from crying. Her hair is a tangled mess. She hands him the piece of paper, and promptly bursts into tears. Buries her head in his chest, sobbing. He cradles her with his good arm. Awkwardly unfolds the crumpled paper and reads:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. CLUTTERED APARTMENT - MORNING Jimmy looks bad. Sprawled out on a tangle of dirty sheets. Jeans. Bare feet. Smoking. Staring at a football card. A duplicate of the one Darian showed him. He swings his legs off the bed. Stands, crushes out his cigarette. Moves into the bathroom. The Baggie of coke is on the counter. He stares at it with bloodshot eyes. Swallows hard. Acts before he can think. Grabs the Baggie. Tosses it in the toilet. Flushes. Watches as it goes down the drain. EXT. CASA LOMA APARTMENTS - MORNING Another Goddamned day. A chill drizzle. The palm trees look forlorn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . He stares at the note, dumbstruck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: They are seated on the dock. Each handcuffed to a metal railing. Pablo kneels and unfastens Joe's cuffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go fuck yourself. Pablo delivers a savage kick to Hallenbeck's ribs. Hallenbeck gasps in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I meant that... in a good way... Pablo hauls him to his feet.    Props him against the railing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for a little payback, Joe. Call it a service to dear departed Chet. He slams a fist into Hallenbeck's middle. Sarah cries out in alarm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that feel, fuckhead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weakly) I'm asshole... she's fuckhead. And with that, Pablo lets him have it. Rains punches on his chest and gut. Slams an elbow into his kidneys. Drives a knee into his groin. Joe hits the deck. Milo calls out from the boat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, Pablo.   I want him conscious. Pablo is kicking Joe's prone form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddamn you, stop it!!     Oh, Jesus, leave him alone! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Pablo gives Joe a last swift kick. Spits on him. Hallenbeck vomits. Lies bleeding on the dock. Sarah crawls over to him. As far as the cuffs will allow. Cradles his head in her lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't... look at me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh. It's okay, Joe. I'm here, it's okay. (strokes his hair) I love you, Joe. Hallenbeck looks at her like she's just grown three heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I get the shit beat out of me... puke all over myself... and now you love me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never stopped loving you, Joe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, you slept with three guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew about the others?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never said anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Figured... you needed them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe, Goddammit, why didn't you say something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?   'Fuck you, Sarah'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Fuck you, Sarah! Anything to show that you... that you had some pride left. A pause.   Then Hallenbeck heaves a sigh. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry... I'm fresh out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm scared, Joe. Get me out of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Must be my trick ear. Sounded like you said, 'Get me out of this.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can take these guys, Joe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got cracked ribs and a concussion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save me, Joe.    Be a hero.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe in heroes.

Hefts the Ingram machine gun, as: ANOTHER ANGLE Hallenbeck thrusts forward, hooks his bound hands around the passing anchor and whoosh -- ! He is catapulted forward, jerked like a rag puppet. BULLETS CHOP the water where he just was. He skims over the waves. Bounced. Battered. Trailing behind Jimmy at fifty miles an hour. Jimmy and Darian begin to haul him in. Struggling. Straining. The boat rushing headlong, driverless. With a last, desperate surge of energy -- They drag Hallenbeck over the side. Into the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad...! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: She collapses, weeping, atop her father. Hugs him for all she's worth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell's she doing here??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stowed away... GUNFIRE splits the air. Reminds them they're not out of the woods. MILO'S YACHT is behind them again. The fire is out.      The chase is on. It steadily cuts the distance. JIMMY'S BOAT Hallenbeck staggers to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get below, Darian. And stay there. He stumbles into the wheelhouse.   Dazed.   Barely conscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got any ideas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Go really fast and hope they don't catch us. (beat) Oh, shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fog bank, dead ahead. Hang on. Into the fog they go, and, folks -- This is really scary. Because you can't see a foot in front of your face. They plunge through the fog at fifty miles an hour. Hallenbeck sweats, eyes glued to the windshield. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: And then a shape materializes off to port: Milo's yacht. Running alongside. Drawing closer. Hallenbeck wrestles the wheel. No dice. The yacht draws ever closer... men on deck... machine guns... Joe looks over... and his face tells the story:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're dead. Except, just then, a strange thing happens: Milo's yacht veers off to the left. Away from Hallenbeck. Jimmy stares, dumbfounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck? They're peeling off. Why? A pause... then it hits Joe like a thunderbolt:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause they got sonar, that's why! Hard to port!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Port?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Left, Goddammit. The boat slews to the left, as, from out of the fog -- The Catalina ferry looms right in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit fuck piss! They almost make it. As it is, they avoid a head-on.   Instead, they hit broadside. A sickening CRUNCH -- ! Jimmy and Joe are thrown from their feet. A momentary glimpse of faces rushing past -- Horrified tourists -- And then the ferry is behind them. Jimmy gets up. Staggers to the controls. Pushes the throttle. The boat lurches forward -- Then SPUTTERS. Fizzles. He swears violently. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're on half power, we lost an engine! EXT. FOG BANK - SAME TIME The crippled boat chugs through the mist. JIMMY swears again.   Bangs his fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're sitting ducks. They got sonar. They can find us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill the running lights and radio the Coast Guard. Jimmy flicks off the lights. Grabs the mike. As he does, a VIBRATING RUMBLE fills the cockpit, causing him to pause... and then stare in shock as their boat emerges from the fog -- And Air One hovers directly overhead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck me. The two men watch, helpless, as the helicopter descends, the Co-Pilot taking aim with a LAWS rocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get down! They both hit the floor.    Hands over their heads -- And then the pilot makes a costly error: He descends right into the path of Milo's yacht. With no warning whatsoever, the boat comes bursting out of the fog -- PLOWS right INTO the HELICOPTER. Second number one: The boat pierces the chopper, rips it to shreds. Second number two: The whole boat-slash-chopper mix erupts in a shower of wood and fiberglass. Turns night into day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JIMMY AND JOE are still huddled on the floor. Pause. They look up. Bewildered. There was a big light... Big noise... Why aren't they dead? ANOTHER ANGLE They move like sleepwalkers to the cockpit window. Stare in disbelief. Joe looks at Jimmy. Jimmy at Joe. Debris rains down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? Jimmy looks:    A bright object... going in circles...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Baynard's boat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) It can get us to shore faster than this one, don't you think? He starts to turn away. Notices something in the water. Speaks over his shoulder to Jimmy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hand me the pole. Jimmy hands him a long, wooden pole with a hooked end. He fishes in the water. Snares a large, floating object. Swings it aboard. Drops it at Jimmy's feet. The suitcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Birthday present. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He turns away.    Jimmy bends to open the suitcase. Joe heads into the cockpit, Darian beside him. Steers the boat away from the crash site. Toward the senator's boat. Chugs forward on half an engine. O.S., Jimmy suddenly yells:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy fucking shit!! EXT. BAYNARD'S BOAT - SAME TIME The once-mighty Marlineer runs aimless circles in the mist. Half the cockpit is blown away, probably by a LAWS rocket. The Hatteras pulls up alongside, and Hallenbeck steps to the rail, carrying the Baretta.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait here. He swings aboard the senator's boat. Gun cocked. Ready. INT. SENATOR'S BOAT - COCKPIT Enters the cockpit. What's left of the roof is bullet- pocked. The navigator is dead. Slumped over the controls. Joe pulls him off the panel. KILLS the ENGINE. INT. MAIN CABIN Joe bursts inside.    Hard and fast.   Gun leveled. No need. It's a slaughterhouse. The walls are perforated. Baynard and his men are dead. The suitcase's evil twin lies unopened on the table. Hallenbeck walks over to Baynard's lifeless body. Stares into the wide-open eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Cal.    Life in the big city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DOCK - SAME TIME Hallenbeck crouches next to Darian, looks her in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen carefully. I'm gonna go get your mom back, okay? You're gonna go in the Denny's restaurant and stay there. Talk to the waitress but don't mention me. Mom and I will come pick you up later, got it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (crying) They're gonna kill you...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding? I do this for a living. (hands her a twenty) Buy me an ice cream. I'll be back. (beat) I love you. She throws her arms around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your prints are all over that boat. What happens when they find the bodies inside?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quit being a fuckin' killjoy. He cuts the headlights.   Cruises to a stop behind a road- side dumpster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.   We've got some things to pick up. EXT. HALLENBECK'S HOUSE (WEST L.A.) - NIGHT They creep across a suburban lawn, hugging the shadows. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Across the street, Hallenbeck's house is dark.       Deserted. Truly a sight: Jimmy, in a white shirt and tuxedo pants, nursing a broken arm; and Joe, drenched to the skin, pants hanging in scorched tatters. Joe suddenly puts up a restraining hand. They stop. Crouched behind a eucalyptus tree. Joe points: THEIR POV A late-model Buick is parked just up the street from his house... There is a man slouched inside. Smoking. BACK TO SCENE HALLENBECK Shit.   Someone's staking me out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (clears his throat) Oh, I forgot to tell you. The police want you for killing Mike Miller. Hallenbeck shoots him a withering look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I got someone!   Four o'clock! MILO is draped over a piece of wooden wreckage. Half his hair is burned away. His face is blistered. He looks up, pleading, at the Ensign, as: ANOTHER ANGLE He hides the Ingram beneath his body, cocked and ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. PARKED BUICK - NIGHT The sour stakeout cop reaches for a job necessity: the pot to piss in. He undoes his fly. Pees into an old Maxwell House coffee can. Opens the door to dump it out. A hand reaches in, lightning quick. Grabs the can, throws it back in his face. As he jerks backward, blinded, the hand knocks him cold. EXT. BUICK - SAME TIME Hallenbeck drags the unconscious cop from the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get him inside and tie him up.

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? That's a cop!     You don't punch cops!

direction.raw_text: I forgot.    Hurry up. INT. HALLENBECK'S BEDROOM - MINUTES LATER The cop is bound and gagged in the corner.      Unconscious. Hallenbeck moves hurriedly. Not a second to waste. Pulls a dark turtleneck from a drawer. Rips off the sleeve. Throws it to Jimmy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wear that. He strips off his own shirt.   Crosses to the closet.

direction.raw_text: You know how to use a gun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. He hands Jimmy a shotgun and a box of odd, black cylinders. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Use these. They're shredders. Equipped with an explosive charge. When you fire the gun, they spray on impact. Take out anything within ten yards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you gonna use?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little souvenir... He reaches into the closet. Pulls out a sniper rifle. The rifle. The one responsible for the puckered scar on his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go bring the car around. EXT. HALLENBECK'S HOUSE - SAME TIME Jimmy emerges, starts across the lawn. Pulls up short. Stares ahead at: HIS POV - TWO BLACK SEDANS parked at the curb. BACK TO SCENE He starts to cry out -- And a dark figure looms behind him. Clubs him in the head. INT. HALLENBECK'S BEDROOM - SAME TIME Hallenbeck snaps a full magazine into the rifle. Stuffs extras into a black Windbreaker. Hears a NOISE. Looks up, expecting Jimmy -- Draws a sharp breath: PABLO AND ASSORTED GOONS standing in the doorway. All of them have guns. Pablo grins, shakes his head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Face it, pal.    You're fucked by God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PAD AND PAPER as they're placed in front of Hallenbeck. He is seated on the bed. Three guns covering him. Beside him sits Furry Tom, grinning his stuffed-toy grin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you a literate man, Joe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a subscription to Jugs magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's good. See, Joe, what you're gonna do, you're gonna write a little story. A GOON sticks his head in the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got Jimmy Dix in the trunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get him out of here. Take him to Mr. Marcon. I'll follow you as soon as my business here is finished. The Goon departs, leaving Hallenbeck with Pablo and two others. He studies them. Calculates the odds. Verdict: Bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, you're gonna write a little story, Joe. About how guilt- stricken you are over Senator Baynard's death, which is all over the air waves, by the way. Yeah... you're so guilty about paying those hitmen to kill him, that you're gonna kill yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, who's writing this story? You're doing all the good parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, and, Joe...? Don't forget to include how guilty you are over that cop you murdered.

direction.raw_text: What cop? (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Pablo draws his pistol. PUMPS TWO SHOTS into the unconscious cop in the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son of a bitch...! Pablo is making a big mistake, but he doesn't know it. He is fueling Joe Hallenbeck's rage. Pity the fool. Hallenbeck regards him with dead, lifeless eyes. A thoroughly unnerving stare. Then Joe does something very odd. He says, softly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't like Pablo very much, do we, Furry Tom...? There is a pause... And then, incredibly -- Furry Tom answers. A high-pitched, squeaky stuffed cat voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as Furry Tom) No, Mr. Hallenbeck, we think Pablo is a motherless fuck who takes it up the ass. Dead silence. Pablo is completely thrown; so are we, for that matter... and then it hits us: Joe is doing ven- triloquism. And the funny thing is, he's really good. Pablo overcomes his shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, is he doing that? Hallenbeck's face remains cold.    Expressionless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Furry Tom, tell Pablo what I'm gonna do to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as Furry Tom) You're gong to make Pablo eat all his teeth, Mr. Hallenbeck. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Pablo can't help it.   He bursts out laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's amazing, man! Hallenbeck picks up Furry Tom. Inserts his hand, makes the furry head bob back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as Furry Tom) Hey, Mr. Hallenbeck, they're laughin' at me. That's not very nice. By now, all three hoods are in hysterics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you mad, Furry Tom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as Furry Tom) I don't get mad. I get even. And, with that, Furry Tom's mouth opens -- And EXPLODES, showering stuffing. One of the goons is still laughing when he realizes half his throat is gone... And Furry Thomas BELCHES FIRE again, and the second goon goes down in a spray of blood, and if you haven't guessed already -- Joe has a gun hidden inside Furry Thomas. Pablo is a little sharper. A little quicker. He dives forward, knocks the puppet from Joe's hand. Joe drives upward, into Pablo's gut. They reel across the room. Locked in combat. Lamps topple. GLASS BREAKS. Pablo slams Joe's head into the wall.   Leaves a dent. Does it again, a sickening impact... Starts to strangle Joe -- And the truth is, Joe's not thirty anymore. He's not going to make it. The world swims away. Then, as if through a tunnel, Joe notices something beside him... something hanging on the wall. Fights to focus. Breath gone.    Strength gone. Identifies the object: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: His Presidential Medal of Valor. Shiny medal. Shiny ribbon. His name... It hits him quite suddenly: The medal has sharp edges. With the last of his strength, he plucks it from the wall. Drives it into Pablo's throat. The big man stumbles backward. Eyes wide. Gurgling. He thrashes, the red-white-blue ribbon flapping obscenely from his gushing neck. Drops to the dusty carpet.    Dies. Hallenbeck takes a deep breath. Eyes wide. Insane. He is surrounded by corpses. He takes another deep breath. Picks up the sniper rifle. Slings it over his shoulder. Heads for the door. INT. CONRAD MARCON'S LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Jimmy Dix is on the floor, and Marcon is kicking him savagely. Pointed alligator boots lashing out. Again and again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know I don't enjoy doin' this, Jim. Jimmy curls up in a fetal ball.    Marcon paces, shaking his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember how much you hated the pain... You got hooked on Demerol, didn't you...? I'll make a deal with you. Tell me who you talked to, and I'll give you all the painkillers you can swallow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody knows. Just... just me... and Hallenbeck...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, see, I'd love to believe you. But we are talking about the future of my football team. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He crosses to the fireplace.   Removes a poker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And ain't nothin' more important than my ball club, 'cept maybe my collection of autographed footballs. Got one of yours, you know. (softly) Who'd you talk to, Jimmy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody... Marcon raises the poker. Brings it down on Jimmy's broken arm. EXT. HOLLYWOOD HILLS - NIGHT Hallenbeck leaves the rented Subaru by the side of the road. He is dressed in combat black. Government issue. Rifle over one shoulder. Hunting knife in a hip scabbard. Like an angel of death, he moves into the brush. Heading down the canyon. EXT. MARCON'S HOME - SAME TIME An armed sentry patrols the grounds. Below him, nighttime L.A. stretches to the Pacific. Joe Hallenbeck emerges like a wraith from the trees. Clamps a gloved hand over the sentry's mouth. Drives the hunting knife into his back. INT. LIVING ROOM - SAME TIME Marcon stirs the fireplace logs, stoking the blaze. Replaces the poker. Crosses to his desk and sits. Jimmy is on the carpet, delirious.   Out of it. Marcon presses a button.   An armed HARDGUY appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Marcon? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's nothing, he can't hurt us. Take him somewhere and kill him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. The Hardguy crosses the room.      Grips Jimmy by the shoulders. With a soft SPIT of sound, his forehead blooms crimson. He collapses, lifeless. At his desk, Marcon whirls, stunned, as: JOE HALLENBECK steps through the French doors behind him. He resembles nothing human. A demon in black. Eyes burning. Gun held loosely. An extension of his arm. Marcon reaches for the button to summon help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't. He jams the rifle barrel into Marcon's throat, nearly crushing his larynx. Hisses:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gun is silenced, I'll fuckin' kill you. Where's my wife?

direction.raw_text: ... I don't remember, I... Joe shoves on the gun.   The barrel chokes him.

direction.raw_text: My wife. Grabs a pen.   Shoves it in Marcon's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The address.    Now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's... Milo's film studio...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Write it down, dumbfuck. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: He speaks over his shoulder:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jimmy, you okay...? Jimmy stirs.

direction.raw_text: Hurts like hell. Marcon finishes writing. Hallenbeck snatches up the address. Stows it in his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Connie, you're gonna walk us out of here, nice and easy, got it? (beat) Can you walk, Jimmy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... I think so -- Joe, behind you...! Too late.    A revolver is cocked a foot from Joe's head.

direction.raw_text: Drop it. It's the same odd voice we heard earlier. The man with the speech impediment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You drop it, asshole, or I kill Marcon. The Strange Man chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, but that won't work. I don't care if he lives or dies, now drop the gun. A pause. Once more, Joe calculates the odds.     No dice. He places the rifle on the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walk over there by your friend, Joe. Hallenbeck turns around... and, for once, his jaw drops. He's looking at a man he never thought he'd see again. A man who suffers from facial paralysis ever since his head bounced off the Georgetown turnpike eight years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOUIS BAYNARD Son of the late senator. The right side of his face doesn't quite match the left. The muscles don't work. Hallenbeck recovers his composure. As Jimmy climbs to his feet, Joe walks over and stands next to him. Two gunmen appear behind them, covering the rear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Goddamn. How's the head, Lou?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aside from permanent facial neuralgia, just lovely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next time, Lou, just say no.

direction.raw_text: Shit. This is the drunk guy you slugged, look what you did to his face! Marcon, meanwhile, is positively livid.   He snaps at Baynard:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son of a bitch, you were gonna let him kill me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing more or less than you'd do for me, Conrad. (turns) I never thought I'd see you again, Joe.

direction.raw_text: In other words, you dropped your father's name a bunch of times. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: (ignores him) But imagine my delight this morning, Joe, when Mr. Marcon informed me of a golden opportunity: a chance to kill my father and frame you for the crime... What can I say, inherit a fortune and humiliate you in the bargain, who could resist?

direction.raw_text: Do I also have you to thank for dragging me into this mess?

direction.raw_text: (sighs) It was I, unfortunately, who bought a forty-dollar bottle of champagne... spoke a little too freely to that hooker.

direction.raw_text: She wasn't a hooker, dickhead.

direction.raw_text: He should know, Jimmy. With a face like that, he's gotta be paying for it.

direction.raw_text: You can die fast or slow, so watch your mouth. Jimmy chimes in:

direction.raw_text: Kill them, Goddammit, waste 'em both!

direction.raw_text: Any bright ideas, Joe?

direction.raw_text: Gimmee a minute.

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, could you give him a minute? He's trying to think of a way out of this. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED: Behind them, the two hardguys COCK their GUNS. Jimmy sweats. He's scared shitless underneath. Hallenbeck clears his throat:

direction.raw_text: You know of course, Connie, that you're a dead man. Marcon holds up his hand.

direction.raw_text: Wait. The gunmen lower their weapons.

direction.raw_text: (shrugs) Nothing much, just that I made a phone call from the boat on the way in.

direction.raw_text: See, Connie, every year, the mob rakes in two and a half billion from football bookmaking. If you succeed in making gambling legal, all that money goes to the government. (beat) I wouldn't be surprised if they put out a contract on you. Of course, I might be able to call it off. Marcon stares him down.    A pause.   Then Marcon smiles: (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's bluffing. He's not connected to the mob, what a load of horseshit. Nice try, asshole. (waves his hand) Kill them.

direction.raw_text: (plowing ahead) Then there's the matter of two million dollars. Or didn't you know that watertight suitcases float...? He once again looks Marcon in the eye.

direction.raw_text: (laughing) Jesus, I don't believe it.    This guy's a riot.

direction.raw_text: Fuck you, Joe, I'm not just gonna stand here and die. Mr. Marcon, he's lying. We do have the money, but it's not in a car, it's in a storage locker. I have the key on me. I'l hand it over if you let me go. Hallenbeck stares in disbelief. The kid's actually trying something.

direction.raw_text: Where is the key, Jimmy? (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . CONTINUED:

direction.raw_text: It's stashed in my shorts.

direction.raw_text: (nods) All right. Slow and easy.

direction.raw_text: Sure.   Slow and easy. Jimmy reaches inside his jeans. Slowly, cautiously pulls something out, concealed in his fist. We see, but Marcon doesn't: It's a shredder shell. He holds it in his fist.

direction.raw_text: Promise you'll let me go.

direction.raw_text: Hell with that, son. Hand it over or I'll have you kneecapped.

direction.raw_text: Oh, yeah? Well, that's too bad. See, it's one of those new plastic keys. The kind that melt...? And, with that, he hurls it into the fire. So fast that nobody can see just what he threw.
